text: 35.5cl bottle. black color. brown head. vanilla, chocolate, cöffee, sweet,smoke, medium bitterness.
Clear dark brown ruby (appears black(, tanned foam head. Nice coffee aroma w/ chocolate tones. Chocolate in taste, subtle bitterness. Nice one. (Velp 201703)

Bottle on train. Pours almost black, dark brown head. Nose is gentle smoke, chocolate, quite big liquorice, sweetish. Tastes sweet liquorice, gentle smoke, roast, chocolate, caramel, very smooth but could be even slightly thicker and richer. Very good anyway.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Smoked, malt, chocolate, tar, some liquorice.
Body: Medium to full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Smoked, roasted malt, chocolate, some caramel,

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malts and smoke.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and smoke.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. The smoke is very light, much too my liking. All the other flavours are not very noticeable either however. Amazing appearance that still keeps the rating up.

Bottle. Bottled May 2014; Drank Sept 2016 - Opaque Dark Brown / Black in colour. Foamy brown head. Very Malty; roasty malts, dark chocolate, liquorice, subtle smoke, caramel. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums. Spicy; lightly spiced. Hoppy; some balancing hop bitterness. Good malt/fruit/spice/hop balance. Sweet-bitter roast chocolate malty and fruity with subtle smokiness. More bitter and increasingly dry into finish. Enjoyable Smoked Porter! (2016-09-04)
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Solidna, ale naprawdę ciekawa i przyjemna paloność i popiołowość.

12oz bottle dated 5-5-14 - pours a thick evil black with a very thin brown head. Liquid smoke aroma with hints of licorice, leather, roasted barley, peat and coffee. Big body, low carbonation and dry mouthfeel. Bitter roast, smoke, peat, booze, bbq, espresso and cacao.

Bottle to tulip - pours jet black, minimal head, disappointingly minimal beige head. Aroma is wood, smoke, leather. Thin on the tongue, dry. More smoke, scorched earth, roasted malts and plain coffee. Dead on for the style.
roasty, leather, smoke, woody, black, minimal head, brown foam, medium bitterness, lightly sour, oily feel, creamy, full body, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bottle at Beer Zone, Iasi, Ro. Pours dark black with little head which dissapates quickly. Faint coffee in the nose. Taste follows with smoke, faint coffee. A bit of liqorice. Nice bitterness. Low carbonation. Great.
Bottle, 355 ml from Beergium. Shared with JFK10000 and Josip. Pours dark brown, small beige head. Smoke, roasted, malty, caramel, licorice, some fruit. Bit thin. Medium bodied.

Zwart bier met weinig bruin schuim. Geur: runderbouillon, licht zoet, cranberry, vanille, chocolade, wat koffie. Smaak: geroosterde mout, bitter, koffie, complex, ietwat zoet, klein cranberry zuurtje. Volmondig. Weinig koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog, licht bitter. Een complex en lekker bier.
Bottle at home, October 16. Black, aroma is roasted malt, slight smoke. Taste is roasty, stout like with slight smoke, not bad

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 32B / 13C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 036:15. AROMA: dark roasted malt aroma with notes of chocolate and also some oxidation. APPEARANCE: pitch black color and opaque. light brown medium head with low retention. TASTE: moderate roasted malt, and almost burnt with a dark chocolate character. very faint smoke note. medium bitterness with an almost dry and roasted finish. PALATE: medium-light body with a slight creaminess. medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a smoked porter outside its expiration date that demans retasting.
Tasty smoked porter, pours a nice dark brown and has a nice smoky aroma, drink it at about 10 degrees.

12 oz single bottle from Mollys Spirits. Black appearance with a light brown head. Aroma of smoked malt, roasted grain, oak, bitter chocolate, light coffee and light earth. Similar flavor, smoky, roasted and lightly spicy with moderate bitterness and light sweetness. Medium to full body with a dry finish. Nice.

This was poured into a becher pint glass.
The appearance was a dark chocolate milky looking color with a sly brown tint to it. A thin edged off white to white foamy head started and dissipated. Spotty lacing runs here and there.
The aroma starts off with some roasty coffee bean blending with some smoked malts. Sly sweet meat slides in to balance nicely.
The flavor starts sweet and leads to a nice balance of smoke. Meaty portion tends to blend subtly with a crisp sweet aftertaste. Nice sweet and smoky finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionably smooth sweet feel just rolling stealthily over my tongue. Beautifully and wonderfully done mouthfeel! Carbonation seems to hit spot on.
Overall, damn nice smoked porter, watch out Alaskan Brewing Company, looks like you have some competition with this one.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hihts of dried fruits, toffee, port and milk chocolate... the taste is fruity and caramel with notes of toffee, dried apples, dried plum, vanilla and milk chocolate... sweet and dry aftertaste... its not the smoked beer, its a good fruity porter...

Color negro con ligera transparencia, espuma baja con adherencia. Malta maltoso tostado moderado, lúpulo floral bajo, notas cenizas-ahumadas, jamón ahumado, ésteres a aceituna botija moderado alto, chocolate, regalíz. En boca malta maltoso tostado moderado, lúpulo floral moderado bajo, tibieza alcohólica, ésteres a chocolate, café, jamón ahumado, fungi, bondiola, prosciutto, ciruela negra, lúpulo de amargor bajo. Final maltoso tostado con notas a chocolate, cenizas y café sin astringencia, con cuerpo medio, carbonatación media.

33cl bottle from SB, bottled may 2014 so its 2 years old.. Black, beige head. Smokey aroma, cacao, wood, sausages. Chocolate flavours, coffee roastiness, not as much smoke in flavor as in aroma. Pretty dry.

11.2 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Purchased in 2013, cellared since then. Black with a finger of tan head that recedes into a ring fairly quickly. Aromas of dark chocolate, smoky and woody notes, raisins and dark fruit, a little soy sauce. Tastes of smoky notes, bitter dark chocolate, caramel, dark fruit, a little vanilla. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Aged fairly well.

Pours black with a low off white head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, roasted nuts, smoky notes. Taste is roasted and chocolatey with nutty and smoky notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Great appearance, nice developing taste that you can enjoy minutes after you tools sip.
33 cl från boxbeers julkalender. Riktig bra på alla punkter! En öl att rekommendera!
black liquid no head. aroma of peat smoke, chocolate. tastes chocolate, medium sweet, medium bitter, light+ sour. medium body creamy, average carbonation,
Bottle. Pours dark brown with pale brown head. Aroma: raddish, roasted, smoked, weak coffee. Taste: roasted, dark plums, coffee, chocolate-cocoa. Full body. Bitter finish. Ok.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Black color, brownish head. Aroma of dark malts, cherries, caramel, ham. Lots of cherries in taste too, roasted malt, caramel, ham, chocolate. Full body, soft carbonation. Awesome!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle 0,33l. Dark dense liquid, smell of smoke, pancetta. Full body, light carbonation. Smoked, roasted taste, a hint of herbs. Smells better than its tastes.
Bottle from Mitsuyas. Big, bold soy sauce bomb nose. Some light treacle and burned cacao nib notes. More soy sauce with a touch of vanilla and charred caramel on the palate. Some Dr. Pepper.

Bottle from Rakuten. Evil Twin Ashtray heart 8.9% a deep brown with ruby highlights and minimal beige head. The aroma is a smokey chocolate while the taste is bitter spicy, oakey, chocolate and smooth. 3.7 good stuff.
Nose: Smoked notes, chark, sou-sauce, licorice and coffee. Aroma: Smoked notes, chark, licorice, espresso, dark chocolate, raisins and soy-sauce. Semi-long, semi-bitter ending.

Dark brown, almost black. Roasted smell, some cacao and peat smoke. Smokey taste but very well balanced. Sweet caramel, roasted malt and chocolate. Imperial stout-ish with a layer of smoke. Slight bitter, smoky finish. Really good.

12 oz. bottle. Opaque ebony pour with a thin film of cream on top. Aroma of smoky char, espresso, soy and a hint of caramel. Flavor has caramel, smoke with some bits of lean meat, soy, charred wood and a touch of apple. Medium-heavy body has too much explosive fizz but a pretty nice balance.
Geruch nach Schokolade, dunklen Früchten und Schinken. Geschmack süßlich und rauchig. Das Raucharoma bleibt sehr lange auf der Zunge. Sehr ausgewogen und rund.
Tiefschwarz. Geruch süß, Trockenobst. Rauchig. Geschmack süß, Aromen mit Rauch, ein wenig Schinken. Wenig bitter, leicht säuerlich.

Bottle in Seattle. Tan foam, black brown. Sweet smoke aroma, moderate body matches the abv. Robust malt and sweet smoke, quite drinkable for the weight, which is not over the top. Bitter, lactic chocolate. Coating finish. Very nice.

Bottle from World Beer Market (Sake no Taniguchi). Dark roast nose, with smooth chocolate, berries, and licorice; also some phenolic notes with smoked fish and charred wood. Deep dark brown color with translucent edges. Flavors of boozy dark fruit, berries, burnt malt, fish oil, and soy sauce. Medium-heavy body, with a full, creamy feeling, a bit oily even, and lightly warming on the tongue. Very interesting nose and unusual flavors for a smoked beer.

Burnt coffee and chocolate aroma. Pours black with a tan head. Quite bitter taste, but nicely balanced. Smoke, coffee and dark chocolate. Feels rich and creamy, low carbonation. Not particularly long. Smooth and nice.

Black pour. Finger of dark tan head. Nose is smoke and roast. On the tongue is creamy dark roast, dark coffee, a slight sweetness and a smoky finish. Mouthfeel is smooth and slightly bitter on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Tom. Brown blakc with a beige head. Aroma of peat, caraeml, roasted malt and prunes. Sweet caramel,chocolate and smoked flavors, cocoa and roasted bitterness. Medium-bodied, smooth and plesant. Nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L place. Thanks Tom. Opaque black with brown head. The aroma has some smokiness, notes of wood, ash and some toastiness. Sour flavor with notes of wood, very smoked, some toastiness, bitterish. Oily texture, sticky, medium to full-bodied. Very good.
Pours deep dark with thin brown head. Nose is leather and smoke. Aromas are roasted and smoked malts, coffee, whisky and woody notes. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and smokey finish.

Pours almost black. Very undercarbonated with a very slight tan head. Overwhelming flavour of ashtray (as promised on the label) with notes of burnt toast, liquorice and rubber. Some caramel and roasted malts underneath the ash flavours. Complex and very full tasting. An interesting and individual beer.

At a tasting, thanks, smallish creamy head, deep brown color, aroma of a smoke and rubber with some charred notes, flavor of smoke and heavily toasted bread with some dark chocolate, stingy carbonation. Nice enjoyable and quite mellow.
From a bottle. Could be the best smoked beer Ive ever had, super smooth and the smoke is not over the top, delicious.

Aroma of smoke, roasted malts and canine. Pours a octopus-ink black with a thin khaki head and moderate lacing. The taste is robust. Smoke, roasted coffee, chocolate, roasted malts -nice. Full body and medium carbonation. Overall, excellent brew with a brilliant name.
Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Black with small beige head. Aroma is smoke, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is smoke and dark malt.
33 cl. bottle. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour od smoke, malt, chocolate, dry bitterness, alcohol and caramel.

Bottle from Whole Foods. Pretty black with an average sized light brown head that diminishes quickly but never disappears, and leaves very scant lacing. Aroma of roast, chocolate, wood smoke, and vanilla. Tastes like roasted chocolate and charred wood (or at least what I imagine those things taste like) with a touch of dark fruit and moderate bitterness. Medium bodied, slick, and slightly boozed. Good shit.

ours a deep dark brown with a small reddish brown head. Aromas of liquid smoke, sardines, and firewood. Flavors of chocolate, espresso, and smoke. Nice dry crisp finish. Smokey aftertaste stays with you for awhile.

APARIENCIA: totalmente negra, que no pasa la luz a través de ella, corona de espuma de mediana retención, color marrón, burbujas compactas algunas abiertas y que mancha muy bien el vaso.

AROMA; notas de café tostado, chocolate, maltas tostadas, frutos oscuros maduros, por ahí muy discreto aroma a ahumado.

SABOR:: notas ahumadas de entrada, que si bien están bien marcadas no llegan a hastiar, atrás las notas de café tostado, chocolate, maltas tostadas, ligera notas ácida no astringente; el retrogusto con amargor medio bajo, con persistencia del sabor ahumado, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: Cuerpo medio algo cremoso, de baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: una excelente cerveza, aunque en la etiquete diga porter tiene más carácter de stout, y el ahumado, que no es astringente en ningún momento, le va de maravilla.

Bottle 355 ml. Black color and dark brown foam. Aroma: very wine with dried apples and other dried fruits, coffee, roasted malt, not «overpowering smoked», but a little. Taste: rich and velvety, burnt, roasted, caramel, prune, whisky, hints of oak, strong hop bitterness, smoked quite delicate.

Uit de fles geschonken. Een mooi zwart bier met bescheiden schuimkraag. Aroma is een mooie mix van geroosterde mout en gedroogd fruit. Die combinatie komt ook in de smaak terug, lekker rokerig met fruit! Daarbij komt nog wat hop in de nasmaak. Een hele mooie bijzondere porter.

Black colored, small non lasting dark tan creamy head. Aroma is chocolate, some dark fruits, strong roasted malt and burnt, ashtray notes. Taste is medium sweet chocolate, light dark fruit, some smoke notes, strong- ashy burnt notes and roasted malt, dry medium bitter roasted finish, rather lasting aftertaste, alcohol very well hidden. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, bit creamy. Very easy drinkable for a smoked imperial stout. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)
Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl. @ Cervezorama 2.0, Madrid, España. A: Black / Negro. T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, smoky, chocolate / Malta tostada, dulce, ahumado, chocolate.

Pitch black with a bubbly beige head and nice carbonation.
Smell is dark raisin sweetness with smoke and meat. Hint of vanilla, deep milk chocolate. Toffee and liquorice.
Taste is smokey ash, leather and earth. Bitter and dry, salty with a nice fizz. Astringent finish with coffee and chocolate. Warming, delicious!

Aroma is dark malts, dark chocolates, smokey and ashy. Taste is dark fruits, roasted malts, a pinch of bacon, slight salty and smoke. Normally not that into smoked beers, but this one was really good.

Pitch black, tall tan head, all that jazz. Aroma full of prunes, black chocolate and coffee with only light hints of wood and leather in the warmed-up beer. Medium-high body, pleasant texture with medium carbonation. Taste is full of burnt wood, black chocolate, ground coffee and prunes. Dry burnt finish. Overall a really good beer with only a single slight flaw - aroma - which reminds more of a straight imperial stout rather than some smoked beer.

Bottle.

A- Smoke, slightly meaty.

A- Black color, black liquid, light brown head.

T- Smoke, subtle umami, roasty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, smoky finish.

O- Holy smokes! No pun intended. What a beer. The deScription is pretty truthful too. I dont know many people that would enjoy this but I loved it! Tons of smoke but not overpowering. Damn fine beer.

Pours black with small medium brown head. Loads of smoke and iodine in the aroma. Reminds me of the way Laphroaig smells. Unexpectedly light body---medium in this case. Bitter, dark aftertaste goes on and on. Very good.
Black with no head. Glorious, glorious smoky aroma. Thick, smokey, smooth, chocolate-y. Perhaps just a tad too sweet, otherwise excellent.
Black with no head... low carb. Medium thin body, light smoky, milk chocolate. Surprisingly light for the ABV. Tasty stuff, but Id have liked to have had more smoke going on...
Bottle. Tasting session @ Budapest. Black color, small dark brown head. Smoked, a tad acidic, also light chocolate scent. Cmoked, tar, wet stone, sausage taste. Smoked, ashtray aftertaste.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and no foam.Smell: roasted malt, smoked malt, and soy sauce.Chocolate notes. Taste: full body with roasted malt and soy sauce. Caramel and smoked malt. Smoked ham notes. Good attenuation. Coffee finish. Aftertaste: soy sauce, smoked wood. Dry coffee and small alcohol finish.

I was disappointes in this beer due to its lack of smoke character, which is far less than a rauch bier or even a good smoked porter. Expensive at $5 for the bottle. Black, amooth palate. Low carbonation and no head. Some alcohol flavor, heavily roasted malt and some chocolate. A very light hint of smoke.
0,355& fles gedeeld met lion. Zwart met een mooie bruine kraag. Aroma is groene appel smaak Is asbak en ketjap in de afdronk. Mondgevoel mooi vol en co2 op de achtergrond

A deep dark stout with thick collapsing frothy dark brown head. In aroma, sweet fruity chocolate malt with light peated notes, grassy hops, licorice, alcohol warmth, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity chocolate malt with nice smoked salmon overtones, licorice, light woody notes, alcohol warmth, very nice and smooth. Bottle. Case of the punks.....

Flaska från SB. Kolsvart med lågt beige skum. Doft av lägereld, tjära, aska, torv och lite bränd toast samt rökig mörk choklad om sådan finns. Medellsöt, bra balansen och rejäl kroppen. Rökigheten är tydlig men inte överväldigande. Eftersmaken bränd och ganska torr. Kanske inte min favoritölstil men att det är bra bryggt kan t o m jag konstatera.
Pitch black and beautiful. Fizzy head though. Absolutely Wonderful aroma - sweet and dark fruity, rasinins and smoke, vanilla and chocolate. Roasted, smoked and sweet Taste.

I Bibeln talas det om det sjunde inseglet som bryts av ett lamm och orsakar en "tystnad som varade vid pass en halv timme". Riktigt vad det där inseglet är blir såvitt jag vet aldrig utrett på ett tillfredsställande vis, men jag har mina aningar nu när jag har druckit Ashtray Heart. Kanske knäckte det där lammet en porter av det mustigare slaget och kände hur allt runtomkring bara tystnade, så som ett riktigt bra öl ofta gör. En alternativ tolkning god som någon, med betoning på ordet god. Exegetik för livsnjutare.

The aroma is smoked malts, tar, grains, a bit of ash, peat, wooden furniture, and a little dark chocolate. Creamy mouthfeel, with moderately foamy carbonation and a medium body. On the tongue its smoky/roasty bitter, quite cerealy, with minor molasses sweetness. The smoke gives this porter much-needed character, but it isnt quite memorable.

Aroma - beechwood/peat smoke - has the day after smoking meat in the rain smell.
Appearance - the body is black, with a beige head about 2" and fades slowly.
Taste - nice smoked beechwood, some additional roast buried behind that. Takes on a little bit of that smoked meat nature in the back end.
Palate - medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, smoky long finish.

Dark with beige head. Nose coffee and roasted malts.
Soft carbonation.
Smoked malts, dark chocolate, bitterness.
Love the ashtray heart... from the first sip to the last. The smokey character adds a lot of depth to this winter warmer.

Rating #1473 - 28.02.2015 - Bottle from Sherbrooke Pours a dark black in colour with a minimal tan head that fades quickly. Distinct smoky aroma. Very unique body, medium alcohol warmth, predominant smokiness on the palate tempered with the dry, bitter roast malt character of the stout. Mild cocoa, vanilla, molasses, burnt sugar, and campfire. Really good smoked brew.
Flaska. Svart med ett litet beigt skum. Dofter av aska, choklad och rostad malt. Smakinslag av karamell, aska, choklad, soja och trä. Rökig avslutning. Medelstor kropp.
Bij Maakun, fles via Sterk Amsterdam. Foamy smokey biatch. Backlog from 2015/07/12.

Dark pour with very high carbonation, producing a thick lacing that lasts throughout the tasting. Smells like burnt wood, bacon and oranges (??). Medium body, made a bit rough by the high carbonation; fruit bitterness, chocolate and dark cherries, and a moderate amount of alcohol.

Bottle from ølbutikken, best before 2015 Brewed at de molen
Heavy smoke, vanilla, woody, chocolate, coffee, black, brown foam, hazy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

From bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of smoke, ashes, roasted malts, licorice. Taste is smokey, roasted malts, licorice, coffee, notes og chocolate as it warms, smooth, low carbonation. Not too shabby.

Charcoal smokey armoa with lots of leather and some chocolate. Sweet malty taste, bit of tartness and finishied of with a quite bitter burntness. Too carbonated. The aroma is really good and give a promise of something more, then the beer dissapoints a bit in taste and carbonation. Still good though
Bottle from SB. Very dark brown with a medium brown head. Malty and smokey tones. Malt, smoke, fruit, coffee and hops. Medium to full body with a nice bitter / roasted finish.

Smoked Porters are generally interesting but you dont often come across one thats as lovely as this one. Color is near-black with brown suds. Just a bit of smoke in the otherwise roasted aroma. Far more than a hint of smoke in the flavor. Yet, this isnt an astringent smoke bomb. Beers that accentuate the tastier side of smoke tend to play up its savory characteristics. Somehow, Ashtray Heart has brought out its subtle sweetness. Notes of caramelized sugar and toasted chocolate. Its rich, thats for sure. Still, its stupid smooth. Good shit, man.
Amazingly dark colour, oily texture, brown head. Modarate intensive aroma, notes of smoke, dark fruits, chocolate, brown bread. Rich body, malty sweetness, modarate bitterness in the aftertaste.

Couleur noire, très légère mousse beige. Nez chocolat et grain de café, pas trop fort. Gout chocolat noir, grain de café, vieille prunes, notes fumées et caramel grillé en fin de bouche. Corps bien oncteux. Pas mal mais pas assez subtile sur le fumé à mon gout.

Where and how:  bottle 355 ml 
Aroma strong, bold front that is a mix of hops, smoke and chocolate. Its blend was done masterfully. Hops in the mid with smoke as wrap. I cant understate how well this is presented.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium plus tanned creamy look.
Base: hazy, brown.
Palate : medium full bodied, average carbonation. Long finish.
Taste: in short  complex. Chocolate malts blending with smoke and hops. As in aroma, everything seems to be in perfect balance and harmony. On top of this, it is very drinkable at 9%. 
 Other notes  superb brew!

Pitch black and opaque with a two finger, frothy beige head that has really good retention, slowly fading into a thick, lasting ring. Streaks of lace left behind. 

Intense aroma with lots of smoke, butane and a very strong phenol/bandaid character. Strong smokiness in the nose with lots of ash, lighter fluid and charcoal. Theres nothing else here to balance out the prominent bandaid/phenols which are really unpleasant. Almost all of the other dark malt notes are completely overshadowed. 

Full bodied with a slightly creamy texture and a very intense burnt/smoke flavor. Really overwhelming with strong acrid unpleasantness. Everything tastes like burning! Charred toast, burnt malt, charcoal burnt wood and ashtray. Really strong but the phenol presence isnt as bad as expected. Its there but not as offensive as it is in the aroma. Still, this beer is very harsh and a chore to choke down. Im a huge fan of smoked beers but I didnt like this beer at all.

Black...impenetrable, couple fingers tan head. Nose is smoke and chocolate malt. Bittersweet. Middle is medium mouth feel, smoked meat, hints of coffee and chocolate. Finish is bittersweet and smoky. Well structured, ABV nicely hidden.

Oily black pour, minimal head. Ash, vanilla, milk coffee. Damn nice palate, roasted just to my liking - not overly bitter, long finish, medium body, standard carbonation, lively. Well-made, tasty, campfire feel, atmospheric and lots of character.

Dark beer with a foamy brown head that shrank pretty quickly to a ring and a slick on the surface. Nose of overripe fruit vanilla and camp fire. Lots of bitter chocolate, vanilla, ripe stone fruit, leather, and stale coffee with an ashy dead campfire smoke that coats it all. This does not give me the meaty sense that some smokes do. Very nice smoked beer.
Flaska från SB. Svart färg med litet brunt skum. Doftar soja rökig malt lakrits och tjära. Smakar rökigt, toner av lakrits, tjärpastiller med en liten nötig eftersmak.

Bottle. An almost black beer with a thick brown head. Aroma of coffee and smoked malts. Smoky taste of coffee, chocolate and berries. Wow!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
sample from bottle. poured a darker black colour with a tanned head. notes of smoked malts, leather, bitter chocolate, acid smoke. tar. and tobacco. mouthfeel is pretty low bodied for the abv.

Bottled 355ml. -Courtesy of hrabren, shared with him and Marko (thanks!) Black coloured, small brownish head, whiff of smoke in the nose. Roasted malt, chocolate, wood, light alcohol and discreet notes of smoke. Roasty finish. Very good but not great.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of Jason; from Old Town. Aroma: Fairly present woodsy, seasoned smoke with a healthy dose of chocolate fudge. Appearance: Inky black pour with a frothy mocha head that settles into a decent skin. Flavor: Wood smoke throughout with minor chocolate undercurrent; chocolate only cuts through a little at the finish, which is dry and ashy. Palate: Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: Totally works from all angles; excellently done and definitely one for the smoke lover.

355 ml bottle thanks to Ingo! Sampled on October 29, 2015. BB end Jan 2016. Bottled 5/5/14.Black color, small dark brown head. Smoked, a tad acidic, also light chocolate scent. Cmoked, tar, wet stone, sausage taste. Smoked, ashtray aftertaste. Medium, almost a bit thin mouthfeel, medium low bitterness.

0.355 l bottle from Hoppiness, Koper, Slovenia. Black with small beige head. Whiskey barrel, wood, not really smoky aroma. Alcohol present. Ash, smoked ham, smoked wood in mouth, bitter. Drinkable, light to medium body, but always roasty smoky presence in the background to the finish.

Thanks Hrabren! Shared with him, Ogivlado and Anja T. Almost black, tinged with amber perhaps, beige aroma. Mandarin aroma, slgihtly tart, covering lovely notes of bacon, full, genuinely lovely. Mild taste, bacon, roasty, sticky molasses, but dry, again mixing with lovely light herbal-mandarin aroma. Very, very drinkable. Roasty notes. Extremely well hidden alcohol, wow, this is extremely well crafted. Very light tasting for the ABV. Too light to be 4+ but still great.
Отлична& справед& хорошо выбрита& копчёно& Идеальн& ложится на язык и затмева&

roasty, nuts, coffee, chocolate, resin, basement aromas, alcohol, butterscotch, raisin, licorice, smoke, black, minimal head, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, excellent!

12 oz bottle from Bishops Cellar. Pours an extremely dark brown with modest-sized mocha-coloured head. Aroma is very roasty/smoky but with a gentle sweetness that provides a little counterbalance and notes of ash, dark chocolate and salt. Flavour is also roast-forward with some definite smokiness, hints of dark chocolate, salt and a little coffee. Slick mouthfeel. Body verging on full. Nice.
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is smoke, coffee and chocolate. Taste follows nose.
Bottle @ Van Moll. Black colour, small off-white head. Smells roasty, salty, liquorice, salmiakki. Tastes liquorice, roasty, coal, ash. Full body, soft carbo.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, koffie, gerookt. Smaakt gerookt vanille, koffie.
Zwart bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt zoet, geroosterd, overrijp fruit. Smaakt overrijp fruit, vanille, koffie. Lekker.

Large beautiful and impressive light brown foam. I love Jeppe s (master brewer) own description of this beer: Unlikely viscous, seductive dark and smoking good. Yes a real heartbreaker. We recommend that only really trained beerchamps can take on this fiendishly addictive and overwhelming good smoked stout. Beware, many experience a slight placebo effect if swallowed.
Am I a well-trained beerchamp? I do not know, for it is not a term I have used on myself. Otherwise, I fully agree with the description. It is viscous and seductive and really smoked. It is a Nils Oscar Rökporter and a Aecht Schlenkerla at the same time, namely with a good deal of smoked malt. A little to the cool side, where you almost feel what it must feel like to lick the skin from a smoked eel. Overwhelming good, it is also because there is left room for coffee flavor and dark bitter chocolate. Addictive I would also like to join. Especially on a cold autumn or winter evening. It brings namely warmth and comfort throughout the body, and it is certainly addictive in the long term. The placebo effect is immediately worse to relate to, for is it not something that, for example. ill patients may feel themselves healthy just by the belief that the doctor prescribed calcium tablets is a newly developed wonderful medicine? If Jeppe therefore believe that beer drinkers can be tricked into thinking that Ashtray Heart is a profound delicate smoked stout, which in reality is brewed from coincidences, then he is mistaken. I can taste that this is really good and well-brewed craft beer. So maybe Im actually a well-trained beer champ!

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a brown head and aroma of smoke, roasted malt, and wood. Taste is of smoke throughout, along with wood, roasted malt, and chocolate leading to more smoke in the finish. Nice smoked brew

With Zach, pours a dark pitch black pour with a large foamy java colored head. Nose is deep smoke and damp wood chips. Taste is massively smokey, malty and dank. Finish is smokey as well, and long. Nopt for everyone ! Quaff Score 7 / 10

This "Smoked Porter" pours a dark, dark brown with a dark brown head dissipating quickly with a bit of stickiness.

You can smell the alcohol esters and toasty-roasty notes of slight caramelized meats.

On the way in you get more smoke and nice dark porter flavors while on the way down you get more alcohol and a nice long finish. 

I like this beer.

alcohol, roasty,
A good and dark beer. Pours an oil black with a nice aroma. Evil twin tap takover 4 pegs.

Pours black with a medium beige head. Aroma is thin and has some pil and smokeyness. Taste is slick and sweet, with some meatiness and smoked malts. Palate is thin though not very drinkable. Overall an okay beer, one of the better smoked beers Ive tried.
This beer smells great with a smokey meat smell that i cant quite describe. The tast doesnt quite live up to the smell. A nice beer with out being amazing. I still rate it though

Bottle. Nose is sweet woody smoke, vanilla, ciggs, touch of cherry. Taste is cherry, vanilla, smoke, sweet cola, emerging chocolate with a dry finish. The smoke is not as pronounced as the nose. 

Mouthfeel is far too carbonated. 

A very nice smoked porter.

Nice subtle smoked beer. Dark brown pour. Campfire, chocolate, coffee aroma. Taste is just slightly smoky, with some licorice, sweetness, and bitterness to complement. Fairly drinkable for a smoked beer.

Bottle @ Home in Berlin


Appearance: Dark brown, with small tan head

Aroma: Smokey roasted malts, some sweetness

Taste: Smoke, chocolate, dark malts, bit of alcohol

Palate: Medium smooth body

Po przelaniu otrzymujemy czarny trunek, któremu bliżej do RIS niż porterów. Piana koloru cappuccino jest bardzo duża (ogromna), szybko się dziurawi i opada. Dwutlenk węgla poszedł w pianę. 

W zapachu z jednej strony mamy przyjemne nuty czekoladowe i kawowe, a także lekko palone. Delikatnie wyczuwalna nuta wędzona - powinno być jej zdecydowanie więcej. 

W smaku mamy czekoladę, kawę i paloność, niedużą ilość nut wędzonych.

I must be missing a lot of other smokey beers reading some of the comments below as this is the smokiest Ive ever had (I am an IPA drinker though). I get cigars. Stale so it recalls kissing a smoker. Medium carbonation with plenty of chocolate and liquorice besides.

Bouteille 33cl, stout or porter, make up your mind, front label says porter, description label says stout.
Couleur noire intense, col moka moyen laissant un léger doré au verre.
Arôme est off pour ma part je note trop de caractère sour aigrelet et de levure. Le fumé perce en rétro avec un léger malté caramel.
Palais offre une palette maltée, crystal, léger cara, moyenne qui nest pas mise en avant par cette levure qui donne un fini un peu chimique à la bière. Cela est renforcé par ce aspect à la liquid smoke qui perce en fin de bouche. Le fumé est là mais noffre pas grand chose de par le point négatif des malts. Garde aussi un fini toffee adouci rappelant les grandes bières allemandes.

One is left in no doubt that this is a smoked beer. Deep and rich sweet wood mates well to a bold and chocolately porter (at least this is how the beer is labelled). Tails off at the finish but the flavours make an impact early.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium thin frothy brown head. Aroma of smoke, licorice, roasted malt and coffee. Bitter taste with some sweetness. Medium to full body.

Poured from bottle into snifter. Poured black with minimal head. Taste is fairly roasty with not much else. There is a deep, subtle sweetness here but it's a bit cloying. The smoke flavor is evenly dispersed throughout. It never stands to the front and announces itself. This is probably good to a lot of people but I was hoping for a stronger, sharper smoke flavor. As it is, it's very decent.

Aroma: smoke and rich malt
App: black, dark tan head with sheet lacing
Flavour: strong malt, loads of smoke with balanced hop 
Palate: finishes with some long mocha and smoke

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle - 
Aroma - tons of dark malts and licorice notes dominate things from the start. Light smoke and charred wood also present with some dark chocolate. Appearance - black, inky body, dark brownish head, 1" thick, creamy. Light retention. Flavor - dominant chocolate flavor, just a smidge of smoke, tar and treacle. Palate - surprisingly not heavy or thick in any way. Medium bodied yet still manages to have a creamy feel. Overall - I thought the smoke aspect could be ramped up a little more to compete with the chocoate/dark malt flavors. Still, really full of flavor and depth.

Butelka 0.33L
Wygląd: Zupełnie czarne, gęste. Piana bardzo obfita, brązowa, zbita, drobno pęcherzykowa. Wygląda świetnie. Piana dość trwała, lacingu brak ale i tak wygląda rewelacyjnie.
Aromat: Dużo paloności, przypalonego drewna z ogniska, śliwki suszone, susz wigilijny, wiśnie, lukrecja, lekka wędzoność, czekolada, alkohol przyjemnie ułożony, lekko wyczuwalny, praliny, likier czekoladowy i ciemne pieczywo.
Odczucie: Wysokie wysycenie, gryzące; ciało średnie; faktura puszysto-kremowa.
Smak: Lekko słodkie na początku ale od razu po tym pojawia się wysoka paloność. Gorzka czekolada, wędzoność ale podchodząca pod drzewną, torfową (może dębowa), ciemne pieczywo, wiśnie, suszone owoce. Lekko metaliczny, żelazisty posmak.
Całość: Musiałem intensywnie nalewać i długo czekać aż piana opadnie, bo wysycenie zdecydowanie za wysokie i przeszkadza. Poza tym wyśmienite piwo, bardzo zbliżone do najlepszych bałtyckich porterów z dodatkiem lekkiej wędzoności. POLECAM.

Deep dark brown-black in colour with a frothy strongly toast-brown medium lasting head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark chocolate, burnt beech-wood/smoke and liquorice develop. Lightly carbonated with a soft-slick texture and a medium-full bodied. Flavours of roast malt bitterness and chocolate sweetness are well balanced with a light well built smoky centre. The finish is drying a bit yet leaving a somewhat juicy impression for a good while.

330ml bottle from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York. Near black in colour with a thin tan head, little lacing. The aroma is of roasted malts, light chocolate, smoke. The flavour is fairly sweet, some chocolate, light smoke, malty. Finishes long, quite sweet.
toast, roasty, smoke, brown, cloudy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, oily feel, lively, long finish,

Bottle. Good smoky aroma with quite a bit of roasted malt as well. Pours black with 2 fingers of mocha brown head and some lacing. Starts with roasted malt as well as a touch of chocolate. Finishes smooth with quite a bit of smoke throughout. Nice smoked stout.

Enjoyed this stout with dinner of chilli. Thought tempted, I didnt pour it into the pot while cooking. Sweet, smoky, high gravity stout with thick head that faded to nothing pretty quickly. Complex raisin, prune, chocolate, and mollases flavors compete with smoky, roasted ones.

Extremely thick head that makes this one really obnoxious to pour if youre thirsty. Real dark. Very carbonated, and I wouldnt call that an asset. Nice and smoky, though, with bits of chocolate and even a bit of meat. Seriously.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours almost black with a massive super dense brown head. Smell of smoke, fireplace, burnt wood, dark malts and peat. Moderate to medium sweet, aggressive carbonation hides a quite thick oily texture, flavors of toast, smoke, wood, dark malts, chocolate and sausage. A strange combo of course, but it works! Moderate bitter, this one is quite exquisite

Very dark, oily. I used much of my bottle in a pot of chili, because I was hoping to get some of the smoke into it. I probably should have sat with a whole bottle first, because I wasnt as taken with the flavor. I got a strong metallic note at the start, and though theres some smoke and roasted porter qualities, Ididnt get as much depth as I would have appreciated. And at this price point, it isnt a successful beer, in my judgment. Bottle.

Tap at hops and pie. Clear dark reddish brown with a thick, brovwn head that lasts on the sides. Aromas of roasted malt, smoke, chocolate, and grape. Flavor is smoke, roasted malt, chocolate, grape, plum, light vanilla and coffee. Medium bodied, smooth.

Piwo butelkowe. Ciężki aromat wędzonki, kawa, czekolada. Kolor czarna smoła, piana bujna bezowa mocno trzyma. W smaku pełne wędzone lekka kawa i czekolada belgijska, mocna słodowa baza z niezłą goryczka bardziej pochodzącą od słodów palonych niż chmielu. Wysycenie średnie. Very good.
Pours an extremely dark black with a heavy frothy tan head. Aroma is a mix of smoke and chocolate. Taste is not as smokey as expected but it is quite complex with toffee and chocolate notes.

Bottle. Poured dark brown with an average tan frothy head that was mostly lasting with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy chocolate smoke malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark sweet smoked flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate duration. Complex solid beer.

Bottle from Hop City. Pours dark black with tan head. Aroma of light smoke, chocolate, spices, and coffee. Flavor of chocolate, molasses, and smoke, with a strong booze aftertaste. Heavy bodied. Its like drinking a boozy camp fire. Very good.

12 oz bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small tan hea. The aroma and flavor have a big smoked character, peat and ash, roasted malt, molasses, chocolate, decent flavor for what it is.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate chocolate, molasses, caramel, and light-moderate smoke. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a three finger creamy tan head that has very good retention. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate, molasses, and a touch of caramel. The finish has light-moderate smoke with some faint roast. Its medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation and a lively carbonation that can be a bit prickly at times.
Mørk brun/svart farve med høyt beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, lakris og lakris. Smak av røstet malt, karamell og røyk. Melkebaren.
Tykt brunt skum, mye skum. Dyp sort farge. Duft av frukter, eple, stikkelsbær og lakris. Smak av lakris, røyk og frukter.
On tap at Flying Dog in Stockholm. Smoky smell with chocolate, dark malts and caramell. Similar taste, roasted flavour with coffee. I love the level of smoke in this one. Lots of flavour.

Lighter aromas than I expected, smoke, chocolate, herbs. Lighter body. First it tastes more like chocolate and herbs, and then you get hit with heavy smoky flavors and some booze, soy sauce, grilled steak.

Pitch black coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma of light smoke, chocolate, herbs, spice, light coffee. Flavour of cocoa, chocolate, molasses, sweetness, light alcohol and vague smoke. Medium to full bodied. Dry chocolaty and light smoked end. Vague roasty bitterness notable

Dark brown, almost black with a creamy brown head.
Aroma has mostly wet wood, smoke and too much alcohol.
Taste has chocolate, roasted malt and slight smoke.
Medium body, high soft carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Dry bitter after taste.
Too little smoke, too much alcohol.

pours very dark brown if not black with a very nice beige head, excellent retention and lacing. roasted and smoked coffee beans, smoked raisins layered in burnt caramel, very peppery, peat, ashes (surprise), dry molasses and maple syrup, minerals. average to light carbonation - wish it had been just a tad softer, medium body - oily, very dry and slightly harsh ashy-resinous-bitter coffee. hint of sweetness and smoother would have helped balance-wise. nice smoked!
Bottle at home. Full body. Dark and smoky. Bitter chocolate. Strong espresso. Roasted malts. Grassy hops. Highly enjoyable :)

(Keg at Pipes of Scotland, Uppsala, 20140922) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had liquorice, smoky charcoal and burnt malts. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were liquorice, dark chocolate, smoke, burnt malts, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt, smoky and bitter. A good and balanced smoked stout.

Dark brown body with a medium brown head. Aroma is roasty, a bit of chocolate, not as much smokiness as I expected from the label. And thats a good thing. Taste is sweet, light bitter. Carbonation is average. Medium body. Not an overly smoked beer but as not a big fan of the kind I prefer the hint of smokiness.

Bottle. Dark brown in color with a tan head. Roasted malts, gently smoked wood and vanilla with sweet notes in aroma. Light smoked and roasted malts in taste mixed together with hints of spicyness and dark chocolate.

33cl bottle @ home from De Molen. Nearly black body, very huge brown fizzy rocky mostly lasting no lacing head. Nose is light ash, smoked bacon, hint of rum, Aroma is moderated smoke, woody, licorice, soy sauce, root vegetables, toast, later hops. Taste heavy bitterness, hint of sourness. Full body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation, long lasting toasty bitter finish. Interesting and easy porter, only the high carbonation makes it difficult to drink it.

Barwa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, obfita, utrzymująca się i ładnie oblepiająca szkło. [

Aromat: zdecydowanie słodowy - czekolada, melanoidyny, lekka wędzonka "mięsna" likier wiśniowy, suszone śliwki. Niestety również nuta metaliczna (potwierdzona w teście skórnym) i nieco alkoholowa. 

Smak: słodowy i zdecydowanie pełny. Słodycz umiarkowana, nieco w stronę wytrawną, choć początkowo odbiór psuje trochę zbyt duże wysycenie, szczypiące w język. Mamy jednak czekoladę, melanoidyny, owoce (wspomniane śliwki i wiśnie), zaznaczona goryczkę oraz "kiełbasianą" wędzonkę (niestety dość subtelną, nie tak wyraźną, jak np. w Beer Geek Bacon Mikkellera) i alkoholowy, rozgrzewający finisz. 

Kolejny Evil Twin i ponownie coś innego- wędzony porter. Niestety, jak dla mnie znowu ta wędzoność jest zbyt subtelna, bowiem preferuję bardziej bezkompromisowe piwa. Barwa i piana do prawdy świetne. Aromat złożony i przyjemny, choć tej wędzonki nieco brakuje. Podobnie jest w smaku, przyjemny balans, dość złożone doznania, ale przydałoby się nieco więcej wyrazistości. Można powiedzieć, że się czepiam i czego więcej chcę od piwa z taką oceną? Nie zapominajmy jednak, że nie jest ono najtańsze, zatem można wymagać trochę więcej. Nie jest to może najlepsza propozycja z tego browaru, ale godna polecenia.
Bottle, Wine Warehouse. Pours black with a large brown head. Smells of smoky chocolate malts. Tastes of smoke, ash, coffee, chocolate, and rubber.
Pours a dark brown with a massive tan foam head. Aroma is smoke and wood. Flavor is smoke, wood, and roasted malts, with a touch of sweetness. Smooth and full-bodied. Tastes great.

A black beer with a ridiculous, huge head that is light brown. The nose is strongly smoked with dry smoke and smoked ham, some tar liquirice, sweetness and roasted coffee. Smokyness isnt so strong in the taste, coffee, some chocolate, the end is roasted and quite dry, also some bitterness. Medium+ bodied, not too much of carbonation. Great aroma, succesfully and smoky beer.

Dark black beer with the perfect head, big bold and everlasting! Some lacing is there too. Aroma has smoked ham, syrup, roasted malts and licorice. Taste is syrup sweet at first, then smoke and roasted flavours kick in. Full body and low carbonation. Excellent smoked porter.

Aroma: smoky salmon, coffee; Appearance: dark brown, minimal head; Taste: medium sourness, medium bitterness; Palate: bitter finish, thick texture, full body, soft carbonation

Terrific smoky porter with well-hidden alcohol

Pours black with with a large brown head. Smells smokey and hints of chocolate. Taste is milk chocolate, smoke, subtle coffee. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Evil Twin Ashtray Heart finishes with a lingering smoke and chocolate kiss.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 Quite good smoky beer with a pleasant aftertaste. A bit expensive but its worth the price.

Bottle from Erzbierschof - Black color with a small tan head - Aroma of smoke, ahes, meat, soy sauce, roasted malt and dark chocolate - flavor of ashes, roasted malt, coffee, licorice and earthy - Full body, medium/high bitterness, overcarbonated, bitterness ashes roasted malt finish - Good but overcarbonated not pleasant and a little bit too smoky for me
330ml bottle, roasted dark chocolate malt, sweet treacle, rich plain choc, moderate smokiness, dark fruity hop bitterness coming through. Not quite balanced, ends a little sweet,

Bottle. Black body with a small disappearing beige head. Aroma is smoky, big surprise there, roasted coffee, ash. Taste follows the smoky theme, adding tar, dark chocolate, light sweetness, with a burned malt finish. Sounds a simple beer but its perfectly balanced and very well crafted, quite enjoyable!

Grassy, earthy aroma, murky black with a small diminishing head, flavours of smoked/burnt earthy straw finishing with a lingering bitter aftertaste, a full body with a lively carbonation on the tongue

Bottle (12 oz). Courtesy of czar, thanks! Dark brown with with a dark brown head and some lacing. Aroma is smokey with tobacco notes, chocolate and coffee notes. Taste is also smokey (not overpowering though) with tobacco again, chocolate, coffee, light fruitiness and hints of alcohol. Medium body. A tad weak for the style/abv. Moderate carbonation. Short aftertaste. Good balance. Nice smokiness. Quite tasty. With a little more body, this one would be excellent.
Tap, Taphouse. Murky, dark brown. Small, tan head. Light, roasted and mildly smoked aroma. Flavour has raw licorice and smoky notes. Dry, bittet finish.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 Black as night with thin off white head smell of smoke obvious. Full mouth feel with milder taste and more sweet that Yin, by same brewer, has nice over all flavor, bitters up at end but not bad.

Whoa, wow. Big waft; surreal! The moment the lid comes off, little evidence of life once the seal is broken, the aroma fills the room. Charcuterie meat, peat, heather and kelp tickle the olfactories as does so much smoke and ash - got the name right! The alcohol smudged in there somewhere. Quite poignant. It settles with more than two thirds foam atop an inky back body. Highly carbonated (well unexpected), the head is fuelled for the length and this gives the palate a prickly, champagne-like effervescence. Good body underneath, but remains masked. Hot, fusel alcohol burn to the finish is a little harsh. Smoky, ash-tray and charred, smoke-house meats dominate the flavour. Peaty, earthy and robust. Lasting with woody, nutty notes coming through and a little dried, mace and cassia bark spice lingering on the tongue keeping it lively. This is the first Evil Twin Ive actually enjoyed. It is a pungent cocktail of malts but it works. Nice! (33cL, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

From a bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a creamy light brown head. Tastes like roasted malt, ash, light tobacco, alcohol, light earth, and molasses. Nicely balanced complex flavor. Dry feel, light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like ash, tobacco, alcohol, andight sweet cocoa.
(Backlog) Draft an rattle n hum, 2011. Black pour with tan head. Peat, sweet, chocolate and roasted aromas. Similar flavors, smoke not overbearing.

Very Piceous black and viscous pour with a rich mahogany brown head. The nose is right smoky upfront with big cured meats and black strap molasses. A bit sharp at the end of the flavor with a metallic note. Big and heavy flavor with smoke dominating things. Touch of camp fire. Full body .

Bottle. Black, small top. Roasty nose, really roasty with black patent, slight herby hops. Body is lightish and easy. Dunno where the abvs hidden. Some chocolate, milky such. lean nice mouthfeel. Nice drink. Really roasty, but light, lean.

Flaska från Khioskh, Cph. Svart öl med brunt skum. Doften är rostad med lakrits, mörk choklad och blöt aska. De rostade tonerna av malt och kaffe är de mest framträdande de rökta, askiga tonerna kompletterar. Riktigt god.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a large mocha colored head. Aroma is of, well, smoke. Flavor is sweet and slightly bitter with a smoky aftertaste that lingers in the mouth. Body is thick. This is a high gravity beer and the alcohol is well hidden. This ranks among the best smoked beers I have tried, including ...uh....

Bottle pours dark, small cream head. Big smokey nose, chocolate. Taste follows with dark chocolate upfront, some espresso. The smoke foundation is from first sip into the after taste. Medium body, well done.

Draught at Backcountry Pizza. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, nuts, hops, licorice and chocolate. Bitter finish with hops, roasted malts, chocolate and nuts. Excellent imperial porter.

Bottle thanks to czar, thanks bro! Pours a really dark brown with a small brown head that leaves good lacing. Nose is fun with some good smoke, coffee, bar room. Taste is not an ounce to sweet and even feels dry to some extent, some alcoholic wonders maybe? Flavors are smoky of course but also offer some slight meaty angles and plenty of coffee. All the roasted malt also give some licorice impressions. Body is full, almost stout-ish, carbonation medium. Overall this was really good, a nice smoky treat!

Expectation: sky high, because I love smoked beers as well as porters and Evil Twin seems to make solid brews 
Hardware: 12oz bottle (made on 1/3/14) into Le Guinness 
Nose: good ole smoke 
Sip: toast, roast and caramel  
Taste: muddled 
Misc: weak boby, but no booze bite 
Conclusion: disappointed. downhill after the first sip.
Black pour, small brown head. Aroma is coffee and smoke. Where am I, a cafe? Flavor is roasty, smoky and sweet with notes of chocolate, coffee and cream. Delicious, medium bodied.
Color negro con espuma beige. Aromas ahumados, frutos Rojos y café. Cuerpo medio con inicio dulce y afrutado al que sigue el toque ahumado y el final amargo, seco y tostado. Muy rica.

Tap (Birofilia2014, Zywiec)
Stinky. Watery. Black. Sticky flat palate. Sweet. A dark roast, but thin. Nope, sub-par rauch and a sub-par stout.

Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, light smoke, a little liquorice. Flavour is roasty, only slightly smoked, light sweetness. I would have liked more smoke, as it is this is quite moderately smoked, but thankfully there is a very tasty Porter behind that layer.

Looks.. Cola black/brown, sml dark tan head.
Smells.. Smoked/peated coffee choc, burnt sugar and some vanilla
Tastes.. Rich fruit/choc cake, smokey choc and coffee, burnt caramel, tar mildly sweet finish. Very impressive. Best smoke/peated beer Ive had.
Bottle. Black with a light brown head. Smokey, peat, oak, malts, burnt toast and a light earthiness. Tastes like burnt toast made over a campfire, dry and smokey. Light syrup with a fizzy feel.

Poured a deep black with brown head with good retention, lacing decent but not perfect. Aroma of licorice, chocolate, and smoke. Flavor was vinous, licorice, chocolate, meaty smoke, molasses, dry ashtray smoke in the finish, a quite nice experience, on par with Bamberg but as a stout. Bamberg needs a RauchSchwarz to challenge this guy. Mouthfeel was smooth and fluffy big as in a dry stout but with some lingering stickiness on the lips. Ive been out of regular ratings over the recent years, have been on a week long resurgence, and it is beers like this that provide a little spark to keep doing it. Great stuff for a brewer I indulged a handful of pricey stateside purchases at SL and with somewhat lower than published expectations - but so far so good. Rock on, evil twins!
Black beer with a thick brown head. Taste of roasted malt, licorice and some mild smoke. Quite balanced, good beer.

Tap. Pitch black color. Tiny to almost no head. Malty, faint roast, faint iron in aroma. Metallic, sweet, milky, sourish taste. Cannot detect alcohol. Medium carbonation. Messy, very messy. Where is ash? Where is smokiness? Where is beer?

Bottle. Black with a small tan head. Aroma is caramel, malty, chocolate, a little smoke. Flavour is indeed ashy, with a reasonably sweet body of molasses and caramel malt, a chocolatey and smoky finish. As is often the case with smoked beers this builds nicely. Lovely beer.

Bottle from Bierkoning, thank you! Wow, where to start... Ashtray, burned cables, tar, lots of tar. Lots of roast as well. Vanilla flavoured coffee notes. Peat and leather. Rakija and cachaca. Multilayered, yet skillfully combined into a single bullet. Nothing seems out of place in here, everything is perfectly blended together. Thick, sweet, warming. Extreme. On the sip, it feels like an oily imperial stout at first, before becoming remarkably drier in the finish, dispersing into all those more unusual notes of burned cables, leather and tar. The atypical flavours do not dominate, they are the spicing of an already excellent imperial stout that is deep, rich and flavourful. Yes, it kinda feels like having had a sip of an imperial stout drenched in an old ashtray but hey, why does it taste so good then?

Pours dark brown with a small deep tan head. The aroma has lots of smoke, smooth roast, chocolate, cream, milk and vanilla. The malt is peaty and well integrated with the rest. It has a medium body that is lighter than expected and has a bit of crispness and minor sharp carbonation. The flavor starts off with smooth deep roasted malt, light smoke, minor spice and cream. The finish has a bit of char and peat. Nice.

From Craftissimo. Ink black with sudsy oaty tan head. Smells of soy sauce and roasted malt - the combination of salt and roast makes me think of bacon. Background aroma of ash. Tastes smoky, very bitter hop, a bit of citrus, quite a burnt/sour finish. Slick but frothy body that has lots of residue/protein particulates. Big, very interesting beer that I'm glad I tried but probably too salty/burnt for me to want to rush out and buy again. Love the name though!

Bottle from Craftissimo at home. Deep black pour with dense light tan head. Aroma is bacon, very smokey, roasted malts. Taste is a bit sour at first, hoppy bitterness, salty smokey finish. Palate is not as rich as it looks - it works. A bit of a silty/powdery palate too which isn't that noticeable but not nice. Interesting beer - glad to try but wouldn't get again.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Pitch black, small tan head, some lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, smokey, coffee, liquorice, alcohol, molasses, dark chocolate. Taste, roasted malts, smoke, liquorice, dark chocolate, molasses.

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks ArizviSG. Black, with tan head. Quite mild phenolic aroma, and sweet, then smoky with a little ash taste. Medium-to-full body, sweetish chocolate finish beneath all the smoke.
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique 240614. Pours a thick syrupy black with a crest of brown foam. Great smoke aroma and flavour.
Good smoky aroma and flavour, with complex taste. Not as aggressively smoky as I thought it would be, very tasty.

aromat prawie jak w klasycznym porterze angielskim, ciemne słody, gorzka czekolada... wraz z ogrzewaniem wychodzi coraz mocniejsza bamberska szynka. W smaku wędzonka jest już bardzo silna, świetnie gra z ciemnymi słodami. Bardzo pijalne. Wielkiej filozofii tu nie ma, ale piwo robi robotę!

Appearance: Bottled 2/5-2014. Basically black. Very creamy, cappuccino like foam, only much darker.
Aroma: Lots of smoke, dark malt, coffee, bacon.
Taste: Nice smoke, dark malt, coffee, tar. Still quite smooth, though. Very nice.
Bought: Erzbierschof, 355 ml, CHF 5.90
Info: 20/6-2014

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 2/5/2014. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, roasted malt, wood smoke, toast, dark bread, light char, leather, herbal, and roast/smoke earthiness. Nice aromas with solid complexity and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt notes; with good strength. Taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, toast, dark bread, molasses, coffee, wood smoke, leather, herbal, and roast/smoke earthiness. Good balance and complexity of dark/roasted/smoked malt flavors; with solid robustness and no cloying flavors after the finish. (2 bottles from Kevin.  Thanks!)  Evil Twin Ashtray se présente comme une bière impériale.  Sa coiffe brune est spectaculaire.  Son nez est à lui seul époustouflant. Sa bouche me plaît énormément.  Des flaveurs cohésives qui font de mon enthousiasme une expérience philosophique, un voyage mystique dans lequel mon esprit peut librement se sentir habité par un sentiment de joie extatique lié à une dimension dinfini et déternité.  En dautres mots, des saveurs câlistement bonnes qui me rendent tout simplement heureux.  Son corps est tout aussi agréable.  Il a décidément été bâti autour du concept de la buvabilité.  Sa finale torréfiée et enfumée laisse traîner une amertume houblonnée de moyenne intensité.  Tout compte fait, une bière originale et audacieuse.  (33 cl.  BB 2015)
